doc_id: ministry_it::it_cert::How to apply for an IT certificate?
title: How to apply for an IT certificate?
content: Ministry of IT & Digital Affairs | IT Certificates | How to apply for an IT certificate? | Fill the online form and upload your NIC. Processing takes 5-7 business days.

metadata.instructions: Visit the digital portal at https://example.com, register and submit your application.

title: What documents are required?
content: Ministry of IT & Digital Affairs | IT Certificates | What documents are required? | NIC, educational certificates, and proof of residence.

metadata.instructions: All documents must be in PDF format.

title: How to access government e-services?
content: Ministry of IT & Digital Affairs | Digital Services | How to access government e-services? | Visit the portal at https://services.gov.lk and login with your digital ID.

metadata.instructions: First-time users need to register with their NIC.

doc_id: ministry_it::digital_services::How to report a portal issue?
title: How to report a portal issue?
content: Ministry of IT & Digital Affairs | Digital Services | How to report a portal issue? | Use the 'Report Issue' link on the portal or email support@services.gov.lk.

metadata.instructions: Attach screenshots and steps to reproduce the issue.

title: How to request API access?
content: Ministry of IT & Digital Affairs | Open Data & APIs | How to request API access? | Complete the API access form and provide a project description; approvals take up to 10 working days.

metadata.instructions: Provide an example use-case and contact email.

title: Are datasets free to use?
content: Ministry of IT & Digital Affairs | Open Data & APIs | Are datasets free to use? | Most datasets are open under the national open data policy; check the license on each dataset.

metadata.instructions: Cite the dataset ID when reusing.

doc_id: ministry_it::cyber_security::How to report a cyber incident?
title: How to report a cyber incident?
content: Ministry of IT & Digital Affairs | Cyber Security | How to report a cyber incident? | Contact the national CERT via cert@it.gov.lk and provide logs and incident time.

metadata.instructions: Preserve logs and avoid powering off affected devices.

title: Where to get cybersecurity training?
content: Ministry of IT & Digital Affairs | Cyber Security | Where to get cybersecurity training? | See the trainings page on the ministry portal; scholarships are available for small businesses.

metadata.instructions: Apply through the training portal.

title: How to register a school?
content: Ministry of Education | Schools | How to register a school? | Complete registration form and submit documents to the Ministry. Processing time is 30 days.

metadata.instructions: Attach school layout, principal NIC copy and approval letters.

doc_id: ministry_education::schools::How to apply for teacher certification?
title: How to apply for teacher certification?
content: Ministry of Education | Schools | How to apply for teacher certification? | Submit teaching qualifications, experience letters and complete the online application.

metadata.instructions: Original certificates may be requested for verification.

title: How to check exam results?
content: Ministry of Education | Exams & Results | How to check exam results? | Visit results.moe.gov.lk and enter your registration number. Results are released 6 weeks after the exam.

metadata.instructions: Keep your registration number safe for checking.

title: How to appeal a result?
content: Ministry of Education | Exams & Results | How to appeal a result? | Submit an appeal form within 14 days with required documents and payment of fee.

metadata.instructions: Provide a copy of the original question paper if requested.

title: Who is eligible for scholarships?
content: Ministry of Education | Scholarships & Grants | Who is eligible for scholarships? | Eligibility varies by program; most require academic merit and income proof.

metadata.instructions: Submit documents before the scholarship closing date.

doc_id: ministry_education::scholarships::How to apply for grants for schools?
title: How to apply for grants for schools?
content: Ministry of Education | Scholarships & Grants | How to apply for grants for schools? | Fill the grant proposal form and attach the school budget and project plan.

metadata.instructions: Proposals are evaluated quarterly.

doc_id: ministry_education::adult_education::How to enrol in adult learning classes?
title: How to enrol in adult learning classes?
content: Ministry of Education | Adult Education | How to enrol in adult learning classes? | Check local community centers or apply online for evening classes.

metadata.instructions: Many programs are free or low-cost.

doc_id: ministry_health::health_services::How to register at a health center?
title: How to register at a health center?
content: Ministry of Health | Health Services | How to register at a health center? | Visit your nearest health center with NIC and proof of address. Registration is free and can be completed in 15 minutes.

metadata.instructions: Bring original NIC and a medical referral if you have one.

doc_id: ministry_health::health_services::How to get immunizations for children?
title: How to get immunizations for children?
content: Ministry of Health | Health Services | How to get immunizations for children? | Child immunizations are available at any government clinic; bring child health book and NIC of parent.

metadata.instructions: Follow the national immunization schedule.

title: How to access counselling services?
content: Ministry of Health | Mental Health Services | How to access counselling services? | Contact your nearest hospital psychiatric unit or call the mental health helpline.

metadata.instructions: If emergency, go to the nearest ER immediately.

title: Are counselling services free?
content: Ministry of Health | Mental Health Services | Are counselling services free? | Basic counselling is free at government facilities; specialized therapy may have fees.

metadata.instructions: Check service details at the local health center.

doc_id: ministry_health::public_health_campaigns::How to find vaccination camps near me?
title: How to find vaccination camps near me?
content: Ministry of Health | Public Health Campaigns | How to find vaccination camps near me? | Check the campaigns page on the ministry website or local health office notices.

metadata.instructions: Bring ID and follow instructions for mass vaccination days.

title: How are campaigns scheduled?
content: Ministry of Health | Public Health Campaigns | How are campaigns scheduled? | Campaigns are scheduled regionally and published on the ministry calendar.

metadata.instructions: Subscribe to SMS alerts for your district.

doc_id: ministry_health::medical_records::How to get a medical certificate?
title: How to get a medical certificate?
content: Ministry of Health | Medical Records & Certificates | How to get a medical certificate? | Request a medical certificate from the treating hospital; fees may apply for formal letters.

metadata.instructions: Provide patient ID and date of visit.

title: How to register a vehicle?
content: Ministry of Transport | Vehicle Registration | How to register a vehicle? | Submit proof of ownership, ID and road-worthiness certificate at the transport office.

metadata.instructions: Ensure the vehicle passes the inspection before submission.

title: How to transfer ownership?
content: Ministry of Transport | Vehicle Registration | How to transfer ownership? | Both parties must sign the transfer form and settle any outstanding fines before transfer.

metadata.instructions: Bring original registration book and ID copies.

doc_id: ministry_transport::driver_licence::How to apply for a driving licence?
title: How to apply for a driving licence?
content: Ministry of Transport | Driver Licence | How to apply for a driving licence? | Pass the learner test, complete driving lessons and submit medical and ID documents.

metadata.instructions: Learner permit valid for 6 months.

title: How to renew a licence?
content: Ministry of Transport | Driver Licence | How to renew a licence? | Apply online or at the licensing office before expiry and pay the renewal fee.

metadata.instructions: Bring current licence and ID.

doc_id: ministry_transport::public_transport::How to report a bus route issue?
title: How to report a bus route issue?
content: Ministry of Transport | Public Transport Services | How to report a bus route issue? | Use the transport complaints portal or call the public transport hotline.

metadata.instructions: Provide route number, time and vehicle details.

title: How to get concessions?
content: Ministry of Transport | Public Transport Services | How to get concessions? | Senior citizens and students can apply at the transport office with ID and proof of status.

metadata.instructions: Concession cards issued after verification.

title: How to report road hazards?
content: Ministry of Transport | Road Safety & Regulations | How to report road hazards? | Call the road safety hotline or use the mobile reporting app with photos and location.

metadata.instructions: Do not try to clear hazards yourself â€” report to authorities.

title: How to register for tax?
content: Ministry of Finance & Tax | Tax Registration | How to register for tax? | Register online via the revenue portal with identity documents and business details.

metadata.instructions: Keep your TIN for future filings.

title: Who must register?
content: Ministry of Finance & Tax | Tax Registration | Who must register? | Individuals with income above the threshold and all businesses must register.

metadata.instructions: Check threshold updates on the revenue website.

title: How to file taxes online?
content: Ministry of Finance & Tax | Tax Filing & Payments | How to file taxes online? | Use the revenue online portal, upload required documents and submit payment through available methods.

metadata.instructions: Retain receipts and acknowledgement numbers.

title: What are payment options?
content: Ministry of Finance & Tax | Tax Filing & Payments | What are payment options? | Credit/debit card, bank transfer and designated payment agents are accepted.

metadata.instructions: Payments must be made before due date to avoid penalties.

doc_id: ministry_finance::grants_subsidies::How to apply for a business grant?
title: How to apply for a business grant?
content: Ministry of Finance & Tax | Grants & Subsidies | How to apply for a business grant? | Submit a proposal with financials; evaluation committee meets monthly.

metadata.instructions: Include recent audited accounts if available.

title: Are subsidies means-tested?
content: Ministry of Finance & Tax | Grants & Subsidies | Are subsidies means-tested? | Some subsidies are means-tested; check specific program requirements.

metadata.instructions: Provide income proof if requested.

doc_id: ministry_finance::public_spending::Where to find the national budget?
title: Where to find the national budget?
content: Ministry of Finance & Tax | Public Spending & Budgets | Where to find the national budget? | The national budget and spending reports are published on the finance ministry website.

metadata.instructions: Use published CSVs for data analysis where provided.

title: How to register land?
content: Ministry of Housing & Land | Land Registration | How to register land? | Submit title deeds, surveys and ID to the land registry; registration time varies by district.

metadata.instructions: Ensure survey plans are certified by a licensed surveyor.

title: How to check title disputes?
content: Ministry of Housing & Land | Land Registration | How to check title disputes? | Visit the land registry or use the online title search service to see encumbrances.

metadata.instructions: Keep transaction receipts and surveyor certificates.

title: How to apply for subsidized housing?
content: Ministry of Housing & Land | Housing Allocations | How to apply for subsidized housing? | Submit an application with income proof; shortlisting is done based on criteria and availability.

metadata.instructions: Include family size and current address proof.

title: Can I transfer allocated housing?
content: Ministry of Housing & Land | Housing Allocations | Can I transfer allocated housing? | Transfers are restricted; apply to the housing authority with valid reasons and documents.

metadata.instructions: Provide supporting legal documents for transfers.

doc_id: ministry_housing::building_permits::How to apply for a building permit?
title: How to apply for a building permit?
content: Ministry of Housing & Land | Building Permits | How to apply for a building permit? | Submit plans certified by an architect, land documents and pay the assessment fee.

metadata.instructions: Allow time for environmental and safety clearances.

title: How to pay land tax?
content: Ministry of Housing & Land | Land Tax & Rates | How to pay land tax? | Pay via the local council portal or at designated revenue centers; keep the receipt.

metadata.instructions: Check deadlines to avoid interest/penalties.
